title: Even Larger
statementHtml:
An array is called good if, for every subarray∗∗ of length at least 22, the sum of the elements at even indices (with respect to the original array) is greater than or equal to the sum of the elements at odd indices. Array indexing starts from 11.

For example, the arrays [3,8,4,4][3,8,4,4] and [2,3,1,4,2][2,3,1,4,2] are good. The array [0,2,4,1][0,2,4,1] is not because, in the subarray [2,4,1][2,4,1], the elements at even indices in the original array are 22 (index 22) and 11 (index 44), while the only element at an odd index is 44 (index 33). Since 2+1<42+1<4, the condition does not hold for this subarray.

You are given an array of nn non-negative integers a1,a2,…,ana1,a2,…,an. In one operation, you can decrease any element in the array by 11, but all elements must remain non-negative. Your task is to find the minimum number of operations needed to make the array aa good. It can be proved that it is possible to make the array good using a finite number of operations.

∗∗An array bb is a subarray of an array aa if bb can be obtained from aa by the deletion of several (possibly, zero or all) elements from the beginning and several (possibly, zero or all) elements from the end.
inputSpecHtml:
Each test contains multiple test cases. The first line contains the number of test cases tt (1≤t≤1041≤t≤104). The description of the test cases follows.

The first line of each test case contains a single integer nn (2≤n≤2⋅1052≤n≤2⋅105) — the length of the array aa.

The second line of each test case contains nn non-negative integers a1,a2,…,ana1,a2,…,an (0≤ai≤1090≤ai≤109) — the elements of the array aa.

It is guaranteed that the sum of nn over all test cases does not exceed 2⋅1052⋅105.
outputSpecHtml: For each test case, output a single integer in a new line — the minimum number of operations needed to make the array aa good.
noteHtml:
In the first test case, the array aa is already good, so the answer is 00. Below are the checks for each subarray:

SubarrayEven Index SumOdd Index SumCondition met?
[3,8][3,8]8833Yes
[8,4][8,4]8844Yes
[4,4][4,4]4444Yes
[3,8,4][3,8,4]883+4=73+4=7Yes
[8,4,4][8,4,4]8+4=128+4=1244Yes
[3,8,4,4][3,8,4,4]8+4=128+4=123+4=73+4=7Yes

In the second test case, the array aa is not good:

SubarrayEven Index SumOdd Index SumCondition met?
[0,2][0,2]2200Yes
[2,3][2,3]2233No
[3,5][3,5]5533Yes
[0,2,3][0,2,3]220+3=30+3=3No
[2,3,5][2,3,5]2+5=72+5=733Yes
[0,2,3,5][0,2,3,5]2+5=72+5=70+3=30+3=3Yes

However, if we perform an operation on index 33, the array becomes [0,2,2,5][0,2,2,5] and is good now:

SubarrayEven Index SumOdd Index SumCondition met?
[0,2][0,2]2200Yes
[2,2][2,2]2222Yes
[2,5][2,5]5522Yes
[0,2,2][0,2,2]220+2=20+2=2Yes
[2,2,5][2,2,5]2+5=72+5=722Yes
[0,2,2,5][0,2,2,5]2+5=72+5=70+2=20+2=2Yes

Therefore, the answer is 11.
